Name: filebot
Overview: FileBot is the ultimate tool for organizing and renaming your movies, tv shows

userid.Name: User ID
userid.Description: ID of the user the application runs as.

groupid.Name: Group ID
groupid.Description: ID of the group the application runs as.

umask.Name: Umask
umask.Description: Mask that controls how file permissions are set for newly created files. The value of the mask is in octal notation.

niceness(priority).Name: Niceness (priority)
niceness(priority).Description: Priority at which the application should run.  A niceness value of -20 is the highest priority and 19 is the lowest priority.<br><b>NOTE:</b> Setting a negative value requires additional permissions.  Thus, <i><b>--cap-add=SYS_NICE</b></i> must be added in <i>Extra Parameters</i> (shown when <i>Advanced View</i> is enabled).

displaywidth.Name: Display Width
displaywidth.Description: Width (in pixels) of the application's window.

displayheight.Name: Display Height
displayheight.Description: Height (in pixels) of the application's window.

secureconnection.Name: Secure Connection
secureconnection.Description: Whether or not an encrypted connection should be used to access the application's GUI.  Set to <i><b>1</b></i> to encrypt the connection.<br><span style='color: red;'><b>Note:</b></span> When enabling the secure connection, security parameters needs to be generated.  This <b>one-time</b> operation is done during container startup.  Depending on your system, this could take a few minutes.  GUI of the application won't be available until the operation completes.

extrax11vncoptions.Name: Extra x11vnc Options
extrax11vncoptions.Description: Extra options to pass to the x11vnc server running in the Docker container.<br><span style='color: red;'><b>Warning:</b></span> For advanced users. Do not use unless you know what you are doing.

opensubtitlesusername.Name: OpenSubtitles Username
opensubtitlesusername.Description: Username of your OpenSubtitles (https://www.opensubtitles.org) account.  Required to download subtitles.

opensubtitlespassword.Name: OpenSubtitles Password
opensubtitlespassword.Description: Password of your OpenSubtitles (https://www.opensubtitles.org) account.  Required to download subtitles.

customoptions.Name: Custom Options
customoptions.Description: Custom arguments to pass to FileBot.  This applies to the UI only.

usefilebotbetaversion.Name: Use FileBot Beta Version
usefilebotbetaversion.Description: When set to <b><i>1</i></b>, FileBot installed under <i>/config/beta</i> (container path) is used.  If no FileBot installation is found under this folder, the latest beta version is automatically downloaded during container startup.  <b>NOTE</b>: Use at your own risk.  Beta version may have bugs and stability issues.

automatedmediacenterinterval.Name: Automated Media Center: Interval
automatedmediacenterinterval.Description: Time (in seconds) between each invocation of the Automated Media Center (AMC) script.

automatedmediacenterinputstabletime.Name: Automated Media Center: Input Stable Time
automatedmediacenterinputstabletime.Description: Time (in seconds) during which properties (e.g. size, time, etc) of files in the watch folder need to remain the same before invoking the Automated Media Center (AMC) script.  This is to avoid processing the watch folder while files are being copied.

automatedmediacenteraction.Name: Automated Media Center: Action
automatedmediacenteraction.Description: Action performed by the Automated Media Center (AMC) script on files.  Valid values are <b><i>test</i></b>, <b><i>copy</i></b>, <b><i>move</i></b>, <b><i>symlink</i></b>, <b><i>hardlink</i></b>, <b><i>keeplink</i></b>, <b><i>duplicate</i></b> or <b><i>clone</i></b>.  Use the <b><i>test</i></b> operation to perform a dry-run and verify that everything gets matched up correctly.

automatedmediacenterconflictresolution.Name: Automated Media Center: Conflict Resolution
automatedmediacenterconflictresolution.Description: Conflict resolution strategy used by the Automated Media Center (AMC) script.  When set to <b><i>skip</i></b>, existing files are never overriden. <b><i>auto</i></b> overrides existing file only if new media is better.

automatedmediacentermatchmode.Name: Automated Media Center: Match Mode
automatedmediacentermatchmode.Description: Match mode used by the Automated Media Center (AMC) script.  The <b><i>opportunistic</i></b> mode works for all files regardless how badly they are named, while <b><i>strict</i></b> mode works for reasonably well-named files and ignore files that cannot be matched accurately.  See <i>https://www.filebot.net/forums/viewtopic.php?t=4695</i> for complete documentation.

automatedmediacenterartwork.Name: Automated Media Center: Artwork
automatedmediacenterartwork.Description: When set to <b><i>y</i></b>, artwork is fetched and NFO file is generated by the Automated Media Center (AMC) script.

automatedmediacenterlanguage.Name: Automated Media Center: Language
automatedmediacenterlanguage.Description: Language used by the Automated Media Center (AMC) script to rename files.  Two-characters language code or value like English, French, German, Chinese, etc can be used.

automatedmediacentermusicformat.Name: Automated Media Center: Music Format
automatedmediacentermusicformat.Description: Define how music files are renamed by the Automated Media Center (AMC) script.  Filebot supports a very powerful naming scheme.  See <i>https://www.filebot.net/naming.html</i> for complete documentation.

automatedmediacentermovieformat.Name: Automated Media Center: Movie Format
automatedmediacentermovieformat.Description: Define how movie files are renamed by the Automated Media Center (AMC) script.  Filebot supports a very powerful naming scheme.  See <i>https://www.filebot.net/naming.html</i> for complete documentation.

automatedmediacentertvseriesformat.Name: Automated Media Center: TV Series Format
automatedmediacentertvseriesformat.Description: Define how TV series files are renamed by the Automated Media Center (AMC) script.  Filebot supports a very powerful naming scheme.  See <i>https://www.filebot.net/naming.html</i> for complete documentation.

automatedmediacenteranimeformat.Name: Automated Media Center: Anime Format
automatedmediacenteranimeformat.Description: Define how anime files are renamed by the Automated Media Center (AMC) script.  Filebot supports a very powerful naming scheme.  See <i>https://www.filebot.net/naming.html</i> for complete documentation.

automatedmediacenterprocessmusic.Name: Automated Media Center: Process Music
automatedmediacenterprocessmusic.Description: When set to <b><i>y</i></b>, music files are processed by the Automated Media Center (AMC) script.  A value of <b><i>n</i></b> does not process them.

automatedmediacentersubtitlelanguages.Name: Automated Media Center: Subtitle Languages
automatedmediacentersubtitlelanguages.Description: Comma-separated list of subtitle languages to download.  Example: <b><i>en,de,fr<i><b>.

automatedmediacentercustomoptions.Name: Automated Media Center: Custom Options
automatedmediacentercustomoptions.Description: Custom arguments to pass to the Automated Media Center (AMC) script.

automatedmediacenterinputdirectory.Name: Automated Media Center: Input Directory
automatedmediacenterinputdirectory.Description: Directory inside the container used as the input folder of the Automated Media Center (AMC) script.

automatedmediacenteroutputdirectory.Name: Automated Media Center: Output Directory
automatedmediacenteroutputdirectory.Description: Directory inside the container used as the output folder of the Automated Media Center (AMC) script.

automatedmediacenterinstallpackages.Name: Automated Media Center: Install Packages
automatedmediacenterinstallpackages.Description: Space-separated list of Alpine Linux packages to install.  This is useful when the Automated Media Center (AMC) script is configured to invoke a user-defined script that requires tools not available in the container image.  See <i>https://pkgs.alpinelinux.org</i> for the list of available Alpine Linux packages.

configdirectory.Name: Config Directory
configdirectory.Description: This is where the application stores its configuration, log and any files needing persistency.<br>Container path: /config

storage.Name: Storage
storage.Description: This location contains files from your host that need to be accessible by the application.<br>Container path: /storage

automatedmediacenterwatchdirectory.Name: Automated Media Center: Watch Directory
automatedmediacenterwatchdirectory.Description: This is the input folder of the Automated Media Center (AMC) script.  Any media copied to this folder will be processed by the script.<br>Container path: /watch

automatedmediacenteroutputdirectory.Name: Automated Media Center: Output Directory
automatedmediacenteroutputdirectory.Description: This is the output folder of the Automated Media Center (AMC) script.  This is where medias are located once they are renamed and organized.<br>Container path: /output

webportforgui.Name: WEB Port for GUI
webportforgui.Description: Port used to access the application's GUI via the web interface.<br><b>NOTE:</b> This applies only when <i>Network Type</i> is set to <i>Bridge</i>.  For other network types, port 5800 should be used instead.

vncportforgui.Name: VNC Port for GUI
vncportforgui.Description: Port used to access the application's GUI via the VNC protocol.  Optional if no VNC client is used.<br><b>NOTE:</b> This applies only when <i>Network Type</i> is set to <i>Bridge</i>.  For other network types, port 5900 should be used instead.
